comment.author: 89563874@N07
comment._content: According to JJ Colledge "Ships of the Royal Navy" Dart: (ex-Colonial Office yacht Cruiser) Survey ship 470 tons, 133 X 25 ft, 2 guns.  Transferred March 1882.  Lent to NSW Government as training ship.  Sold 9th May 1912 in Sydney.  I have a picture of Dart in a book about the hydro graphic survey work carried out at this time and they are not the same vessel.  However, mine has to be wrong, as it is a three masted ugly ship and the above photo shows an elegant vessel.  According to Lloyds register Dart was designed by St Clare John Byrne and he would not have built an ugly boat.  Dart was built in 1877 in Barrow.  Byrne's other steam "yachts" of this period are very similar in looks.

comment.author: 89563874@N07
comment._content: Found out that the incorrect photo in my reference book is possibly HMS Swinger (seriously)  and was on station during HMS Dart's tour.  Dart seems to have been involved in some reprisals against the native population of New Hebrides in 1883 helping HMS Diamond.  Is there a decent reference anywhere?  I looked on Trove but my search skills are not too good yet.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sidpickle] Good luck working out how to use Trove - it's well worth it! My tip is to use as few search words as possible, and then narrow it down by date and publication. To link an article, copy'n'paste the URL to the left of the "?". [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] quasymody is an expert in finding stuff via Trove, and might offer his own tips. Here are all the references to "hms dart" narrowed down to 1883 - trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/result?q=HMS+Dart&l-decade... And further narrowed to just the 'Australian Town & Country Journal' - trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/result?q=HMS+Dart&l-decade... , which seems to throw up several articles of interest. The 'Sydney Morning Herald' is my favourite for reliable factual information. I think this particular photo is likely to be a little later than 1883 ... [pulls out his magnifying glass] ...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'm no expert! Most of the interesting things I discover on Trove are all the result of pure chance! My theory is that Trove contains a gremlin, and that if you're respectful and kind to this gremlin it can be coaxed to pull a few hidden levers and deliver up all manner of items which you'd otherwise miss.

comment.author: 89563874@N07
comment._content: Thanks guys, these Trove leads were perfect.
